flashcards.english: Tell us the work you do
flashcards.notes: Common conversational phrase asking about someone's occupation or work. Polite plural form (twīre = tell us)

flashcards.english: Wîtagwo atĩa? (What's your name?), Njitagwo [name] (My name is...), Wî mwega? (How are you?), Ndî mwega mûno (I'm very fine), Eha [name]? (Where is...?), Ûyû haha (Here he/she is)
flashcards.notes: Complete introduction pattern. Conjugations: Njitagwo (I'm called), Wîtagwo (you're called), Etagwo (he/she's called), Twîtagwo (we're called), Mwîtagwo (you all called), Metagwo (they're called). Location: Haha (here), Haarĩa (there-near), Kûûrîa (there-far)
